title: Drawing, "Ascension of the Virgin", ca. 1600–50
medium: Pen and brown ink on paper
inscribed: Inscribed in pen and brown ink, lower right: D20.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Drawing of the Assumption of the Virgin.  She stand at the bottom center while being greeting be an angel. To the left of her is a trail of figures and to the right of her a crowd of angels (?).  Above the Virgin at center is St. Thomas holding up the girdle given by Mary.  Throughout the top of the drawing are angels flying above them all.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Ascension of the Virgin", ca. 1600–50.
ca. 1600–50. Pen and brown ink on paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-8116.
